Info.name: railway ties, railroad tie, railroad ties
info: This item is not collected at curbside.
If less than 1.2 meters (4 feet) in length, item can be taken to one of the City's Drop-Off Depots.
If longer than 1.2 meters (4 feet), make arrangements with private company specializing in disposing of this type of waste.

Info.name: tires, vehicle tires, car tires, small truck tires
info: Rubber tires on or off rims, excluding heavy truck, forklift and large off-road tires, are accepted at some Drop-Off Depots.
Total tires up to 20 kg (44lbs) are free to drop off. Fees apply to total tires that exceed 20 kg (44lbs).
Check the Resource Productivity & Recovery Authority for other tire collection sites.

Info.name: cast iron tub
info: Take this item to a Drop-Off Depot. Disposal fees may apply.

Info.name: car seat, x-ray plate, pool tarp, pool cover, pool liner, vinyl pool liner, hot tub cover, pool blanket, windsurf board, solar panels (large)
info: This item is not collected curbside.
Take this item to one of the City's Drop-Off Depot. Please note disposal fees may apply.

Info.name: cooking oil (liquid),  deep fryer oil, vegetable oil
info: Saturate a paper towel with the cooking oil, freeze it or let it harden, and then place it in their Green Bin.
Used cooking oil should never be poured down the sink, drain or toilet because it can negatively impact the system of sewer pipes in your home and neighbourhood, causing sewer backups.
Dispose of used cooking oil at a Household Hazardous Waste Depots or at Community Environment Days.
For cooking oil (liquid) between 10 to 50 litres/kilograms (no more than 20 litres per container), residents can also request a free Toxic Taxi pick-up online or by calling 311.

Info.name: tub, bathtub (non-metal),  fiberglass tub, acrylic tub, shower (dismantled),  fiberglass shower stall, shower insert, metal shower enclosure, shower walls, jacuzzi, vanity (non-metal),  counter top, countertop, kitchen cabinet, kitchen cupboards
info: This item is not collected curbside.
Take this item for disposal as garbage to one of the City's Drop-Off Depots. Disposal fees may apply.

Info.name: election sign
info: The candidate who provided you with the sign should pick it up. Please contact the candidate if it's not collected.
Signs can be brought to select City Drop-Off Depots for recycling for a limited time after elections. Do not place in Blue Bin.

Info.name: lumber, wood, railroad ties, railway ties
info: This item is not collected at curbside.
If less than 1.2 meters (4 feet) in length, item can be taken to one of the City's Drop-Off Depots.
If longer than 1.2 meters (4 feet), make arrangements with private company specializing in disposing of this type of waste.

info: This item is not collected curbside.

info: Take this item to a Drop-Off Depot.
Make sure that all gasoline and oil has been drained. Please note disposal fees may apply.

Info.name: drywall
info: This item is not collected at curbside.
Clean construction drywall, including painted, papered or vinyl covered, is accepted at certain Drop-Off Depots (Bermondsey, Commissioners, Ingram).

Please take this item to one of the City's Drop-Off Depots or Community Environment Days. For HHW between 10 to 50 litres/kilograms, you can request a free Toxic Taxi pickup online or by calling 311.
For more information and locations check https://www.productcare.org/products/hhw/ontario/.

info: This item is Household Hazardous Waste (HHW) and MUST NOT be placed in the Garbage Bin, Blue Bin, Green Bin or put down the drain, toilet or sewer.

info: Remove any batteries and dispose of those as Household Hazardous Waste (HHW). Place empty container in the garbage.

info:

For HHW between 10 to 50 litres/kilograms, residents can also request a free Toxic Taxi pickup online or by calling 311.

info: Reuse plastic bags if possible, i.e. to line your Garbage or Green Bins.
Bags with draw strings, metal detailing and hard handles and compostable bags should be placed in your Garbage Bin.
Otherwise, bundle your bags inside one bag and tie handles closed rather than put the bags in loose.

info: Remove all decorations, tinsel etc. and do not put in any type of bag.
Christmas tree collection occurs in January - refer to your collection calendar for specific dates.
Alternatively, trees may be taken to a Drop-Off Depot as Yard Waste or set out at the curb on Yard Waste collection days starting in March.

Info.name: pumpkin, gourd, jack-o-lantern, Halloween
info: Place pumpkins and jack-o-lanterns in your Yard Waste.
Yard waste in plastic bags will not be collected.
Use kraft paper bags from October to March as items may freeze to containers.
If you do not have other Yard Waste, cut pumpkin in quarters and put in your Green Bin.

Info.name: fallen fruit from trees, windfall, walnuts, pine cone, pinecone, acorn, pine needles, crab apples, peat moss flower pot, coconut flower pot, coco-fiber, coco-fibre, planter
info: Place this item in your Yard Waste.
Yard waste in plastic bags will not be collected.
Use kraft paper bags from October to March as items may freeze to containers.
Leave your grass clippings on your lawn; yard waste containing grass clippings or sod will not be collected.
Please place poisonous and invasive plants in your Garbage Bin.

Info.name: emerald ash borer beetle, EAB, invasive species, infected wood
info: All wood waste, including that which is suffering from the emerald ash borer beetle, can be put to the curb as long as it does not exceed 7.5 cm (3 inches) in diameter.
Securely tie hedge trimmings, brush or branches. Bundles can be up to 1.2 m (4ft.) in length and 0.6 m (2ft.) in width, weighing less than 20 kgs/44lbs.
If items exceed 7.5 cm (3 inches) in diameter, please make arrangements with a private company specializing in handling this type of waste.

Info.name: yard waste, wood chips, wood shavings, lawn chips, mulch, bark, bark chips, garden trimmings, weeds, small shrubs, hay, straw bales, corn stalks, outdoor garden plant, plant bulb, flower bulb, lawn edging (earth removed),  leaf, leaves, bamboo stick, bamboo stake

Info.name: garden brush, twigs, tree limbs, branches, hedge trimmings, tree trimmings, garden trimmings, hedge clippings
info: Please securely tie hedge trimmings, brush or branches. Bundles can be up to 1.2 m (4ft.) in length and 0.6 m (2ft.) in width, weighing less than 20 kgs/44lbs.
The maximum diameter of each branch is 7.5 cm (3 inches).
Please leave your grass clippings on your lawn. Yard waste containing grass clippings or sod will not be picked up.
Please place poisonous and invasive plants in your Garbage Bin.

Place this item in a kraft paper yard waste bag, yard waste bin, or any open top, rigid reusable container with handles.
